DataElement.preferredName: Stage Prognostic Factor Tumor Marker Three Number Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Records prognostic indicators for specific sites or histologies.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Stage Prognostic Factor Tumor Marker Three
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Prognostic indicators for specific sites or histologies.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.:The general personal and health characteristics that have a bearing on the course of a disease and its eventual outcome.

Concepts.definition: The extent of a cancer in the body.
The general personal and health characteristics that have a bearing on the course of a disease and its eventual outcome.

Property.preferredDefinition: A substance sometimes found in an increased amount in the blood, other body fluids, or tissues and which may mean that a certain type of cancer is in the body. Examples of tumor markers include CA 125 (ovarian cancer), CA 15-3 (breast cancer), CEA (ovarian, lung, breast, pancreas, and gastrointestinal tract cancers), and PSA (prostate cancer). Also called biomarker.:No Value Exists

Concepts.definition: A substance present in or produced by a tumor or by the host, that can be used for differentiating neoplastic from normal tissue based on measurements in body fluids, secretions, cells, and/or tissues. Markers are used in diagnosis, staging and prognosis of cancer, provide an estimation of tumor burden, and serve for monitoring effects of therapy, detecting recurrence, localization of tumors, and screening in general populations.
A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Top level term which includes Biological Markers, Risk Factors, and Prognostic Factors.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A substance sometimes found in an increased amount in the blood, other body fluids, or tissues and which may mean that a certain type of cancer is in the body. Examples of tumor markers include CA 125 (ovarian cancer), CA 15-3 (breast cancer), CEA (ovarian, lung, breast, pancreas, and gastrointestinal tract cancers), and PSA (prostate cancer). Also called biomarker._Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification._A system of numbered categories for representation of data. _Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A substance sometimes found in an increased amount in the blood, other body fluids, or tissues and which may mean that a certain type of cancer is in the body. Examples of tumor markers include CA 125 (ovarian cancer), CA 15-3 (breast cancer), CEA (ovarian, lung, breast, pancreas, and gastrointestinal tract cancers), and PSA (prostate cancer). Also called biomarker.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A substance present in or produced by a tumor or by the host, that can be used for differentiating neoplastic from normal tissue based on measurements in body fluids, secretions, cells, and/or tissues. Markers are used in diagnosis, staging and prognosis of cancer, provide an estimation of tumor burden, and serve for monitoring effects of therapy, detecting recurrence, localization of tumors, and screening in general populations.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueDomain.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ReferenceDocuments.name: Tumor Marker 3 Description
ReferenceDocuments.description: COC uses these codes for tumors diagnosed 1998 and forward.  See the COC OADS Manual, 1998 Supplement, for a list of specific sites and histologies. For SEER requirements for the specific sites, histologies, and diagnosis years for which this item is coded, see the 1998 SEER Program Code Manual.
